result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon M Veasley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber for work, child care, medical care, school.

miscConds.notes:
Due to financial hardship, court waived costs.
Defendant to pay all mandatory surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment, at a minimum of 40 hours per week.

No contact with victim, unless approved by the agent.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Restitution ordered to be paid to LaJerrica J. in an amount to be determined in the future.

timeConds.notes:
**11-06-15/ Judge Rebecca Dallet**
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 10 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time in the HOC.


Stayed pending a review.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon M Veasley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 11-06-15 Court order imposing 10 days of condition time.

Defendant Brandon M Veasley not in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 10 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Brandon M Veasley in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 3 months in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served. Huber privileges to apply for work, child care, medical care, school.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 10 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, unless approved by the agent.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Due to financial hardship, court waived costs.
-Defendant to pay all mandatory surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain full-time employment, at a minimum of 40 hours per week.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Restitution ordered to be paid to LaJerrica J. in an amount to be determined in the future.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Brandon M Veasley in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
*
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon M Veasley in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final pretrial held off record.  Defense still needs the 911 call from the state.  Case remains set for jury trial on 8/12/15.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.

Defendant Brandon M Veasley in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial Conference held off the record.    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lajericca J.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brandon M Veasley in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Brandon M Veasley in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
